The day is finished now.
The room is dim, and the sounds are far away.
You climb into bed, and the blanket settles around you.

Everything feels slower.

On your pillow, right where he always waits,
your woolly bear is curled up.
Warm.
Soft.
Very still.

This is the quiet moment.
The moment when the day lets go,
and night comes a little closer.
